TypeSignature.Value: .class public sequential ansi sealed beforefieldinit SKMatrix extends System.ValueType

Docs.summary: 2D Transformation matrix with perspective.

remarks.para: The SKMatrix is a full 3x3 matrix.

It extends the traditional 2D affine transformation matrix with three perspective components that allow simple 3D effects to be created with it. Those components must be manually set by using the , , fields of the matrix.

MemberSignature.Value: public static void Concat (ref SkiaSharp.SKMatrix target, ref SkiaSharp.SKMatrix first, ref SkiaSharp.SKMatrix second);

.method public static hidebysig pinvokeimpl ("libSkiaSharp" as "sk_matrix_concat" cdecl)void Concat(valuetype SkiaSharp.SKMatrix target, valuetype SkiaSharp.SKMatrix first, valuetype SkiaSharp.SKMatrix second) cil managed

Docs.summary: Concatenates the specified matrices into the resulting target matrix.
Docs.remarks: Either source matrices can also be the target matrix.

MemberSignature.Value: public SkiaSharp.SKPoint[] MapPoints (SkiaSharp.SKPoint[] points);
.method public hidebysig instance valuetype SkiaSharp.SKPoint[] MapPoints(valuetype SkiaSharp.SKPoint[] points) cil managed

Docs.param: An array of points that you want to map.

summary.para: Apply the to the array of points and return the mapped results.

Docs.returns: New array allocated with the mapped results.

remarks.para: Mapping points uses all components of the matrix. If you want to ignore the translation, use MapVectors.

MemberSignature.Value: public void MapPoints (SkiaSharp.SKPoint[] result, SkiaSharp.SKPoint[] points);
.method public hidebysig instance void MapPoints(valuetype SkiaSharp.SKPoint[] result, valuetype SkiaSharp.SKPoint[] points) cil managed

Docs.param: Array where the mapped results will be stored, the array needs to have the same number of elements of the array.
Source array with the points to convert.
Docs.summary: Apply the to the array of points and return the mapped results.

remarks.para: Mapping points uses all components of the matrix. If you want to ignore the translation, use MapVectors.

.method public hidebysig instance valuetype SkiaSharp.SKPoint MapVector(float32 x, float32 y) cil managed

Docs.summary: Applies the matrix to a vector.
Docs.remarks: Mapping vectors ignores the translation component in the matrix. If you want to take the translation into consideration, use MapXY.

MemberSignature.Value: public bool TryInvert (out SkiaSharp.SKMatrix inverse);
.method public hidebysig instance bool TryInvert(valuetype SkiaSharp.SKMatrix inverse) cil managed

Docs.param: The destination value to store the inverted matrix if the matrix can be inverted.
Docs.summary: Attempts to invert the matrix, if possible the inverse matrix contains the result.
Docs.returns: True if the matrix can be inverted, and the inverse parameter is initialized with the inverted matrix, false otherwise.
